summary: human cytomegalovirus (HCMV) is a widespread human -herpesvirus with seroprevalence from 40 to 100%. HCMV is a major viral cause of mental retardation and sensorineural deafness in newborns. HCMV is a major viral cause of mental retardation and sensorineural deafness in newborns. the early immune response is a pivotal time for the host to defend against HCMV infection. the early immune response is a pivotal time for the host to defend against HCMV infection. CD147/EMMPRIN is a type-I transmembrane glycoprotein of the immunoglobulin superfamily. it is involved in neural function, pro-inflammation, tumor invasion, and metastasis. extracellular CypA has been reported to induce proinflammatory cytokines through direct binding with the ectodomain of CD147. HCMV mutant (mUS25-1-5p) and the revertant wild type (RvWT) were generated using a bacterial recombineering method. approximately 300 bp of the miR-US25-1 flanking region was cloned into the pcDNA3.1(+) vector. HCMV miR-US25-1-5p (MirBase, MIMAT0001581), miR-US25-1-3p (MirBase, MIMAT0004755), and 13 other screened HCMV-encoded mature microRNAs were synthesized. the siRNAs were transfected into cells using lipofectamineTM 2000 (Invitrogen) supernatants were collected at 12,000 rpm for 30 min. proteins were separated by 8% SDS-polyacrylamide gel electrophoresis. membrane was rinsed 3–5 times for 5 min with TBST. titers of the viral stocks were prepared with the total cells. the medium was harvested 3 to 11 days post-infection by adding an equal volume of 10% (w/v) skim milk. the number of plaques were counted 10 to 14 days after viral infection. Western blot analysis of secreted CypA protein levels and intracellular CypA (inCypA) in total protein lysates in culture mediums of HFF cells at the indicated times post HCMV infection. phosphorylation levels of ERK1/2 (p-ERK1/2), NF-B p65 subunit (p-p65) and IRF3 (p-IRF3) were increased in response to HCMV infection when compared to mock infection with the medium only. however, when endogenous CD147 expression was knocked down by lentiviral-based transduction of CD147-specific short hairpin RNA (siCD147), HCMV-induced phosphorylation levels of a pmirGLO luciferase reporter plasmid containing the 3′ UTR sequence of human CD147 downstream of the firefly luciferase gene was generated. the most likely target site for miR-UL25-1-5p was identified by RNAhybrid in the 3′ UTR region of CD147. luciferase reporter plasmid pmirGLO-CD1473′UTR was tested. the 14 putative HCMV mimics are described in the abbreviations. the predicted hybrid free-energy of miR-US25-1-5p is indicated. miR-UL25-1-5p mimic was transfected with a non-targeting control siRNA (NC) or miR-UL25-1-5p mimic. compared to cells that were transfected with a non-targeting control siRNA (NC) or miR-UL25-1-3p mimic, the CD147 protein level was appreciably reduced after the transfection of the miR-UL25-1-5p mimic. miR-US25-1-5p and CsA appeared to have redundant roles in the inhibition of the CD147-mediated early innate immune response to HCMV infection. these findings suggest that miR-US25-1-5p could function as a CD147-specific short hairpin RNA to inhibit the CD147-mediated early innate immune response to HCMV. mutant HCMV (mUS25-1-5p) by HCMV BAC mutagenesis. mutants were constructed by substituting only three nucleotides of the seed sequence of miR-US25-1-5p. a revertant virus (RvWT) was constructed as a control. the values obtained were averages SD from triplicate experiments. HCMV infection triggers the secretion of CyPA, which then activates the phosphorylation of ERK and downstream NF-B through interaction with CD147. HCMV miR-US25-1-5p Targeted and Down-Regulated CD147 Due to the potential role that CD147 may play in HCMV early antiviral signaling. 147 downstream of the firefly luciferase gene was generated. the most likely target site for miR-UL25-1-5p was identified by RNAhybrid in the 3′ UTR region of CD147 mRNA. the most likely target site for miR-UL25-1-5p was identified by RNAhybrid. luciferase reporter pmirGLO-CD1473′UTR (WT) or pmirGLO-CD1473′UTRm (MUT) for 36 h before dual luciferase reporter assay. miR-US25-1-5p (5p), but not miR-US25-1-3p (3p) specifically down-regulates endogenous CD147 in U251 cells transfected as indicated and harvested two days after transfection. miR-US25-1-5p stably transfected HFF cells were constructed using the lentiviral-based transduction method. the expression of CD147 obviously decreased in miR-US25-1-5p transduced cells. knockdown of the CD147 expression by miR-US25-1-5p could specifically reduce the activation of IFNB1 and interferon-related gene ISG15 and the NF-B downstream genes IL-6 and TNF-induced by HCMV early infection miR-US25-1-5p inhibits CD147-mediated early innate immune response to HCMV. the mutants were constructed by substituting only three nucleotides of the seed sequence of miR-US25-1-5p. a revertant virus was constructed as a control. DNA3.1-CD147 stably-transfected U251 cells for at least 14 days. mutation of miR-US25-1-5p or ectopic expression of CD147 can delay HCMV lytic propagation at low MOI. a) Schematic construction of HCMV mUS25-1-5p and the revertant wild type. HCMV-mUS25-1-5p in control U251 cells and HCMV-WT in CD147 overexpressing U251 cells showed similar growth kinetics. at higher MOI, no differences in virus yield were observed in cells infected with the HCMV mutant virus miR-US25-1-5p. CD147/EMMPRIN is a transmembrane receptor glycoprotein belonging to the immunoglobulin superfamily. it is expressed at varying levels in many tissue cells. several bacterial pathogens, including HIV-1, HBV, SARS-CoV, and measles virus, have been previously found to infect target cells via CD147. endogenous CD147 is required for the maximum activation of NF-B and IFN--associated antiviral signaling that is triggered by HCMV infection. many tumor-related proteins, such as Programmed death 1 (PD-1) and PTEN, are known to play key roles in regulating the innate immunity against viral and bacterial infection. HCMV-encoded miR-US25-1-5p targeting CD147, CD147-blocking mAb, and an inhibitor of CyPA (CsA) can specifically inhibit this process. the modulation of the host immune microenvironment is not only important for tumor virus-induced inflammatory carcinogenesis, but also critical for persistent and latent viral infection. miR-US25-1-5p targeting of CD147 is biologically significant. at least 26 mature miRNA species encoded by 14 pre-miRNAs have been identified. miR-US25-1-5p is transcribed upon infection and highly expressed at 24 hpi. HCMV-encoded miR-US25-1-5p targets a non-HCMV receptor glycoprotein. HCMV-induced paracrine effects of the HCMV-induced expression of CypA could cause an immune microenvironment called “smoldering inflammation”.
